string-array.name: event_rules
string-array.item: Rules and Regulations:\n• Multiple entries from the same device will result in disqualification

Rules and Regulations:
• Individual entry for girls and boys.
• Preliminary rounds will be aptitude test and a confidence testing Roadies interview.
• Shortlisted contestants will enter the main rounds.
• Main rounds consist of different games and tasks to test your guts, confidence, management skills and attitude.
• Final results will be based on judging panel's decision.
• The volunteers have the right to report in case of malpractices by contestants.
• Use of cellphones during the event is strictly prohibited.

Team Info: Individual event 
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details
Contact event coordinator for Rules and Regulations

Rules and Regulations:
• Students must set up their project, remain with it throughout their judging period and remove it at the end of the day.
• Students must be prepared to answer the judges' questions about the content and developement of the projects.
• Students must bring all equipment (including extension cords if required).
• Two power outlets will be provided at the venue for each project.
• A label must be attached to the back of the project with the student's name, telephone number and college name.
• Projects will be judged based on their creativity, novelty and cost effectiveness.

Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

• Crysis: Warhead
• FIFA-11
• Asphalt 8: Airborne
• MotoGP
• Need for Speed: Most Wanted
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Criteria for judgment:
• Team work 
• Technical Knowledge 
• Time Management 
• Management skills

Team Info: 2 members per team 
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Topic: Automation in Day-to-Day Life

Rules and Regulations:
• Participants should be ready with their PPTs at the time of registration
• The way of presentation, your knowledge and the content will have equal weightage
• Your ideas should be conveyed within the time limit of 5 minutes
• Criteria for going to the second round will be your overall performance

Team Info: Individual event 
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• Participation is open to all streams.
• The decisions taken by the programming committee will be final.

Team Info: 2 members per team 
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• Preliminary: Objective type questions based on GK , IQ etc.

Team Info: 2 members per team 
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• Materials will be provided.
• If the maximum number of teams exceeds four, prelims round will be conducted.
• Use of materials other than the materials provided will lead to disqualification.
• Each team will be provided with the same quantity of sand.
• The size of the structure should be in accordance with the quantity of sand provided.
• Judges' decision shall be final and binding on all.
• The organizers reserve all rights to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit.

Team Info: 4 members per team (max) 
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• Papers should be based on civil related topics.
• Papers to be presented will be selected on the basis of abstract.
• The abstract should contain a maximum of 500 words.
• Participants have to mail their abstract for screening in PDF format.
Mail id:esittely.asthra15@gmail.com.
• Last date of submission of abstract is 10th March 2015.
• Only undergraduates and postgraduates from any recognized university can participate.
• The abstracts as well as the paper will be judged on the basis of their innovation, knowledge of the field and presentation skills.
• Time limit for the presentation is 10 minutes. An additional 5 minutes will be given for Q&A
• Judges decision shall be final and binding on all.
• The organizers reserve all rights to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit.

Team Info: 2 members per team (max) 
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• Uses of mobile phones is strictly prohibited during the event.
• You have to pass through a series of checkpoints in the campus or nearby area as per the clues given.
• At each checkpoint you will have a simple task to complete; the clues for the next checkpoint will be hidden inside the task you complete.
• At each checkpoint you will have a time penalty or a bonus depending upon your performance.
• There will be more than one path from one checkpoint to another.
• Only 4 teams will enter into the final round.
• The first team to reach the destination will win.
• The organizers reserve all rights to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit.

Team Info: 4 members per team (max)
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• Materials will be provided.
• Any innovative product using the materials provided can be created and launched.
• Use of any additional material will result in disqualification.
• Only 5 teams will enter the final round.
• Use of mobile phones and other electronic items is strictly prohibited.
• Time is restricted to two hours(for creation of products)
• For launching products 10 minutes will be provided.
• Judge's decision will be final.
• The organizers reserve all rights to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit.

Team Info: 3 members per team (max)
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Stages:
1. Cypher Decryption
2. Back Track
3. Tech Blog
4. The Maze Runner
5. Matrix War

Rules and Regulations:
• Question may be based on computer related topics.
• Judge's decision shall be final and binding on all.

Team Info: 2 members per team (max)
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• The members cannot split during the course of the event.
• There are two stages in the event - The preliminary round is open to all and the top 6 teams at the end of the preliminary will participate in the final hunt for the treasure.
• Use of mobile phones is strictly prohibited during event.
• The first team to reach the destination will win.
• Organizers' decision will be final.

Team Info: 3 members per team 
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Levels:
1. Preliminary
2. Scramble
3. Mashup

Rules and Regulations:
• Use of mobile phones or any other electronic devices is strictly prohibited.
• Change of any participant of a team is not allowed after registration.
• Judge's decision shall be final and binding on all.
• The organizers reserve all rights to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit.

Team Info: 2 members per team (max)
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details
Contact event coordinator for Rules and Regulations

Rounds:
1. Preliminary
2. Semi-final
3. Final

Rules and Regulations:
• Registration fee : Rs. 200 per team\• Students from different institutions can form a team.
• The bot has to reach the destination and score the maximum points with minimum penalties.
• Multiple bots are allowed from same team but with separate registration fees.
• Robots can be built using wheels, tracks or any other styles or methods.
• Length and width of robot must not exceed 30cm X 30cm.
• There is no limitation of height however.

Team Info: 4 members per team (max)
Visit www.asthra2015.com for details regarding Control and Power Supply and Arena Specifications

Rules and Regulations:
• Registration Fee: Rs. 200 per team
• Students from different institutions can form a team.
• Bot maximum dimensions should be 30cm X 30cm X 30 cm.
• Maximum of 24v will be allowed on the bot, no external supply will be allowed.
• Bot can be wired or wireless.
• Maximum weight of the bot is 4kgs.
• Both wired and wireless robots are allowed.
• In case of wireless robots, each robot must be able to support multi frequency so that there is no interference with the opponent’s robots.

Team Info: 2 members per team 
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• Registration Fee: Rs.100 per team.
• Basic knowledge on electronic circuits.
• Event managers' decision will be final.

Team Info: 2 members per team (max)
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• Registration Fee: 100 per team
• Consists of 7 simple levels
• Technical and non technical levels are included
• Event coordinator's decision will be final

Team Info: 2 members per team 
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• Registration Fee: 50 per participant
• Participants will have to reach point A from point B and complete the given task in minimum time.
• Decision of the judges shall be considered as final and indisputable.
• Rules are subjected to change without any prior notice.

Team Info: Individual event
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• The participants should complete the given tasks with maximum perfection in minimum time.
• The maximum time available will be only 10 mins.
• The participants should make sure that at the end of the task all the given parts are include in the assembly.
• Changes can be made to the rules and regulations by the event coordinator.

Team Info: Individual event
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Topic: Power Quality Issues in Power System
• Continuous no break in power
• Voltage regulation
• Sine wave
• Isolation
• Constant Frequency

Rules and Regulations:
• All the contestants should prepare the PPT.
• Presentation time will be minimum 20 mins and maximum time limit will be 30 mins.
• The contestants who are elected to the second level will have to prepare a presentation within 5- 10 mins and presentation time will be less than 10 min.
• Any change can be made to the rules by event coordinator.
• All contestants should bring their own laptops.

Team Info: Individual event
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• A maximum of 3 mins will be allowed but time of completion of task of each team will be noted.
• Each player of a team is allowed to do any of the 6 tasks (like Tag Team).
• Any change can be made to the rules and regulations by the event coordinator.

Team Info: 2 members per team
Visit www.asthra2015.com for more details

Rules and Regulations:
• The time limit for each level is 10 minutes.
• The respective group can skip max 2 levels.
• Participants can use internet connection for solving answers.
• Decisions of the respective volunteer will be final.
• Spot checking and evaluation conducted by respective volunteer.
